intro: Scurrula venosa, commonly known as the veined scurrula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Scurrula venosa is often found in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in partial shade.
